page.title: 10Hilliers Nursery
page.content: On Thursday 13th. June, 1985 we went to Hilliers Nursery, Botley Rd.Romsey. The manager Mr. Wickens explained that a nursery had been situated on the site for 25 years, but it has only belonged to Hilliers for five years. Before this Mr. Wills owned it but this nursery went bankrupt. The nursery opens 9.00a.m.-5.30p.m. Mon.- Sat. and 10.00a.m.-5.30p.m. Sun. The nursery has an increasing number of customers because gardening is a popular hobby. The first plants sold there wete chrysanthemums. Hilliers has ten workers who do a variety of jobs. Some fill shelves and look after the plants. Most of the people have had special college training. The most popular outdoor plant is the rose. The most expensive plants are the Stephanotis(Â£95) and the Bonsai(Â£105). There is a 5% loss to shoplifters.
